title.narrative: Strategic Sector Cooperation on Health Between Denmark and Vietnam, Phase II

description.narrative: The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Health is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Ministry of Health and the Vietnamese Ministry of Health. Through the project, the Vietnamese ministry will focus on strengthening primary health care for prevention, detection, and treatment management of non-communicable diseases with focus on diabetes and hypertension. A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon. Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in Openaid.

To strengthen primary healthcare in Vietnam for prevention, de-tection and treatment management of non-communicable diseases by supporting the development of policies, plans and guidelines, and continuing implementation of a pilot in Thai Binh province.
